newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Rating Corp assigns AAA to Cagamas.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Rating Corp assigns AAA to Cagamas.

text.p: Malaysian Rating Corp Bhd (MARC) said on Wednesday it has assigned a AAA long-term issuer rating to national mortgage corporation, Cagamas Bhd.
In a statement, MARC said it has also assigned Cagamas with a short-term rating of MARC-1.
The ratings apply to all outstanding long- and short-term debt securities issued by Cagamas, the rating agency said.

The ratings "reflect its strategic role in the financial system, strong shareholder support, excellent portfolio quality, prudent asset and liability management policies and strong earnings and internal capital generation capacity," MARC said.
The AAA rating indicates that the ability to repay principal and pay interest on a timely basis is "extremely high", MARC said.
It added that the short-term MARC-1 rating, the highest rating issued by the agency, indicated a "very high likelihood" that principal and interest will be paid on a timely basis.

Cagamas is the sole issuer of debt securities for the purpose of funding the purchase of mortgages. It was established with the aim of promoting development of a secondary mortgage market in Malaysia.
Its key shareholder is the central bank, Bank Negara Malaysia, with a 20 percent stake, while the rest of the equity is divided amongst other financial institutions.
Nearly 99 percent of Cagamas' assets are mortgage-purchased.
The balance are invested in government-issued papers and private debt securities -- which are bank guaranteed and/or AAA rated -- or in other high quality assets, MARC said.
MARC is the country's second rating agency after Rating Agency Malaysia Bhd.
